paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

functional_data.summary: The disease is slowly progressive and reaches the terminal stage in 10.8 years.

variants.segregation_data: The inheritance pattern is autosomal dominant with a high penetrance rate.
variants.additional_notes: The age at onset shows anticipation.
key_quotes: The symptoms are first recognized when the patient is between 18 and 83 years of age, with a mean age at onset of 35.4 years.
The disease is slowly progressive and reaches the terminal stage in 10.8 years.

functional_data.summary: All patients showed decreased visual acuity as initial symptoms.

variants.segregation_data: The inheritance pattern is autosomal dominant.
variants.additional_notes: Vitreous opacities, cardiac failure, and autonomic dysfunction are the main symptoms.
key_quotes: The symptoms were first recognized when the patients were between 31 and 50 years of age, with a mean age at onset of 38.9 years.

functional_data.summary: Cardiac failure is a primary clinical manifestation.

variants.segregation_data: The inheritance pattern is autosomal dominant.
variants.additional_notes: Sensory-dominant polyneuropathy and autonomic failure are less common.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
